question_2333017652923834639: IT: Do you have a strategic plan for application security and use it to make decisions?

question_-3344061069458032857_answer_2: IT: You evaluate the effectiveness at least yearly
question_-3344061069458032857_answer_3: IT: You log identified shortcomings as defects
question_207136565323997405: IT: Do you regularly update your reference architectures based on architecture assessment findings?
question_207136565323997405_answer_0: IT: You assess your architectures in a standardized, documented manner
question_207136565323997405_answer_1: IT: You use recurring findings to trigger a review of reference architectures
question_207136565323997405_answer_2: IT: You independently review the quality of the architecture assessments on an ad-hoc basis
question_207136565323997405_answer_3: IT: You use reference architecture updates to trigger reviews of relevant shared solutions, in a risk-based manner
question_8848809830710095914: IT: Do you test applications for the correct functioning of standard security controls?
question_8848809830710095914_answer_0: IT: Security testing at least verifies the implementation of authentication, access control, input validation, encoding and escaping data, and encryption controls
question_8848809830710095914_answer_1: IT: Security testing executes whenever the application changes its use of the controls
question_7155804185791503697: IT: Do you test applications using randomization or fuzzing techniques?
question_7155804185791503697_answer_0: IT: Testing covers most or all of the application's main input parameters
question_7155804185791503697_answer_1: IT: You record and inspect all application crashes for security impact on a best-effort basis
question_-6599087861391944615: IT: Do you consistently write and execute test scripts to verify the functionality of security requirements?
question_-6599087861391944615_answer_0: IT: You tailor tests to each application and assert expected security functionality
question_-6599087861391944615_answer_1: IT: You capture test results as a pass or fail condition
question_-6599087861391944615_answer_2: IT: Tests use a standardized framework or DSL
question_455698695473591001: IT: Do you create abuse cases from functional requirements and use them to drive security tests?
question_455698695473591001_answer_0: IT: Important business functionality has corresponding abuse cases
question_455698695473591001_answer_1: IT: You build abuse stories around relevant personas with well-defined motivations and characteristics
question_455698695473591001_answer_2: IT: You capture identified weaknesses as security requirements
question_-1364552990706175591: IT: Do you automatically test applications for security regressions?
question_-1364552990706175591_answer_0: IT: You consistently write tests for all identified bugs (possibly exceeding a pre-defined severity threshhold)
question_-1364552990706175591_answer_1: IT: You collect security tests in a test suite that is part of the existing unit testing framework
question_-7242123601190715501: IT: Do you perform denial of service and security stress testing?
question_-7242123601190715501_answer_0: IT: Stress tests target specific application resources (e.g. memory exhaustion by saving large amounts of data to a user session)
question_-7242123601190715501_answer_1: IT: You design tests around relevant personas with well-defined capabilities (knowledge, resources)
question_-7242123601190715501_answer_2: IT: You feed the results back to the Design practices
question_-7100952117724958119: IT: Do you scan applications with automated security testing tools?
question_-7100952117724958119_answer_0: IT: You dynamically generate inputs for security tests using automated tools
question_-7100952117724958119_answer_1: IT: You choose the security testing tools to fit the organization's architecture and technology stack, and balance depth and accuracy of inspection with usability of findings to the organization
question_4740152266433469453: IT: Do you manually review the security quality of selected high-risk components?
question_4740152266433469453_answer_0: IT: Criteria exist to help the reviewer focus on high-risk components
question_4740152266433469453_answer_1: IT: Qualified personnel conduct reviews following documented guidelines
question_4740152266433469453_answer_2: IT: You address findings in accordance with the organization's defect management policy
question_-5323825785841584848: IT: Do you customize the automated security tools to your applications and technology stacks?
question_-5323825785841584848_answer_0: IT: You tune and select tool features which match your application or technology stack
question_-5323825785841584848_answer_1: IT: You minimize false positives by silencing or automatically filter irrelevant warnings or low probability findings
question_-5323825785841584848_answer_2: IT: You minimize false negatives by leverage tool extensions or DSLs to customize tools for your application or organizational standards
question_4021197393569420521: IT: Do you perform penetration testing for your applications at regular intervals?
question_4021197393569420521_answer_0: IT: Penetration testing uses application-specific security test cases to evaluate security
question_4021197393569420521_answer_1: IT: Penetration testing looks for both technical and logical issues in the application
question_4021197393569420521_answer_2: IT: Stakeholders review the test results and handle them in accordance with the organization's risk management
question_4021197393569420521_answer_3: IT: Qualified personnnel performs penetration testing
question_4674960647406794832: IT: Do you integrate automated security testing into the build and deploy process?
question_4674960647406794832_answer_0: IT: Management and business stakeholders track and review test results throughout the development cycle
question_4674960647406794832_answer_1: IT: You merge test results into a central dashboard and feed them into defect management
question_4588225785708880552: IT: Do you use the results of security testing to improve the development lifecycle?
question_4588225785708880552_answer_0: IT: You use results from other security activities to improve integrated security testing during development
question_4588225785708880552_answer_1: IT: You review test results and incorporate them into security awareness training and security testing playbooks
question_4588225785708880552_answer_2: IT: Stakeholders review the test results and handle them in accordance with the organization's risk management
question_-8463639202655823504: IT: Do you analyze log data for security incidents periodically?
question_-8463639202655823504_answer_0: IT: You have a contact point for the creation of security incidents
question_-8463639202655823504_answer_1: IT: You analyze data in accordance with the log data retention periods
question_-8463639202655823504_answer_2: IT: The frequency of this analysis is aligned with the criticality of your applications
question_653530517721014202: IT: Do you respond to detected incidents?
question_653530517721014202_answer_0: IT: You have a defined person or role for incident handling
question_8016069030958078308: IT: Do you follow a documented process for incident detection?
question_8016069030958078308_answer_0: IT: The process has a dedicated owner
question_8016069030958078308_answer_1: IT: You store process documentation in an accessible location
question_8016069030958078308_answer_2: IT: The process considers an escalation path for further analysis
question_8016069030958078308_answer_3: IT: You train employees responsible for incident detection in this process
question_8016069030958078308_answer_4: IT: You have a checklist of potential attacks to simplify incident detection
question_-7602900934506710646: IT: Do you use a repeatable process for incident handling?
question_-7602900934506710646_answer_0: IT: You have an agreed upon incident classification
question_-7602900934506710646_answer_1: IT: The process considers Root Case Analysis for high severity incidents
question_-7602900934506710646_answer_2: IT: Employees responsible for incident response are trained in this process
question_-7602900934506710646_answer_3: IT: Forensic analysis tooling is available
question_3227856319105655641: IT: Do you review and update the incident detection process regularly?
question_3227856319105655641_answer_0: IT: You perform reviews at least annually
question_3227856319105655641_answer_1: IT: You update the checklist of potential attacks with external and internal data
question_3372869350770201666: IT: Do you have a dedicated incident response team available?
question_3372869350770201666_answer_0: IT: The team performs Root Cause Analysis for all security incidents unless there is a specific reason not to do so
question_3372869350770201666_answer_1: IT: You review and update the response process at least annually
question_-7476084007192951810: IT: Do you harden configurations for key components of your technology stacks?
question_-7476084007192951810_answer_0: IT: You have identified the key components in each technology stack used
question_-7476084007192951810_answer_1: IT: You have an established configuration standard for each key component
question_2740949561220473905: IT: Do you identify and patch vulnerable components?
question_2740949561220473905_answer_0: IT: You have an up-to-date list of components, including version information
question_2740949561220473905_answer_1: IT: You regularly review public sources for vulnerabilities related to your components
question_5204064549809084889: IT: Do you have hardening baselines for your components?
question_5204064549809084889_answer_0: IT: You have assigned an owner for each baseline
question_5204064549809084889_answer_1: IT: The owner keeps their assigned baselines up to date
question_5204064549809084889_answer_2: IT: You store baselines in an accessible location
question_5204064549809084889_answer_3: IT: You train employees responsible for configurations in these baselines
question_2693667223134869245: IT: Do you follow an established process for updating components of your technology stacks?
question_2693667223134869245_answer_0: IT: The process includes vendor information for third-party patches
question_2693667223134869245_answer_1: IT: The process considers external sources to gather information about zero day attacks, and includes appropriate risk mitigation steps
question_2693667223134869245_answer_2: IT: The process includes guidance for prioritizing component updates
question_4124449162772906706: IT: Do you monitor and enforce conformity with hardening baselines?
question_4124449162772906706_answer_0: IT: You perform conformity checks regularly, preferably using automation
question_4124449162772906706_answer_1: IT: You store conformity check results in an accessible location
question_4124449162772906706_answer_2: IT: You follow an established process to address reported non-conformities
question_4124449162772906706_answer_3: IT: You review each baseline at least annually, and update it when required
question_-3865133261829353850: IT: Do you regularly evaluate components and review patch level status?
question_-3865133261829353850_answer_0: IT: You update the list with components and versions
question_-3865133261829353850_answer_1: IT: You identify and update missing updates according to existing SLA
question_-3865133261829353850_answer_2: IT: You review and update the process based on feedback from the people who perform patching
question_6711038967366759999: IT: Do you protect and handle information according to protection requirements for data stored and processed on each application?
question_6711038967366759999_answer_0: IT: You know the data elements processed and stored by each application
question_6711038967366759999_answer_1: IT: You know the type and sensitivity level of each identified data element
question_6711038967366759999_answer_2: IT: You have controls to prevent propagation of unsanitized sensitive data from production to lower environments
question_-5536395266287267543: IT: Do you identify and remove systems, applications, application dependencies, or services that are no longer used, have reached end of life, or are no longer actively developed or supported?
question_-5536395266287267543_answer_0: IT: You do not use unsupported applications or dependencies
question_-5536395266287267543_answer_1: IT: You manage customer/user migration from older versions for each product and customer/user group
question_8580442960506868112: IT: Do you maintain a data catalog, including types, sensitivity levels, and processing and storage locations?
question_8580442960506868112_answer_0: IT: The data catalog is stored in an accessible location
question_8580442960506868112_answer_1: IT: You know which data elements are subject to specific regulation
question_8580442960506868112_answer_2: IT: You have controls for protecting and preserving data throughout its lifetime
question_8580442960506868112_answer_3: IT: You have retention requirements for data, and you destroy backups in a timely manner after the relevant retention period ends

question_-8635987629819838735_answer_0: IT: You document the status of support for all released versions of your products, in an accessible location
question_-8635987629819838735_answer_1: IT: The process includes replacement or upgrade of third-party applications, or application dependencies, that have reached end of life
question_-8635987629819838735_answer_2: IT: Operating environments do not contain orphaned accounts, firewall rules, or other configuration artifacts
question_792796231736178614: IT: Do you regularly review and update the data catalog and your data protection policies and procedures?
question_792796231736178614_answer_0: IT: You have automated monitoring to detect attempted or actual violations of the Data Protection Policy
question_792796231736178614_answer_1: IT: You have tools for data loss prevention, access control and tracking, or anomalous behavior detection
question_792796231736178614_answer_2: IT: You periodically audit the operation of automated mechanisms, including backups and record deletions
question_9069879412548517933: IT: Do you regularly evaluate the lifecycle state and support status of every software asset and underlying infrastructure component, and estimate their end of life?
question_9069879412548517933_answer_0: IT: Your end of life management process is agreed upon
question_9069879412548517933_answer_1: IT: You inform customers and user groups of product timelines to prevent disruption of service or support
question_9069879412548517933_answer_2: IT: You review the process at least annually
